thread.title: California Lawmakers Travel To Australia For Drought Lessons
thread.title_full: California Lawmakers Travel To Australia For Drought Lessons

author: Associated Press
title: California Lawmakers Travel To Australia For Drought Lessons
text:
California Lawmakers Travel To Australia For Drought Lessons Tuesday, October 20, 2015 By Associated Press Credit: Associated Press Rain clouds form in the sky over a desalination plant in Sydney, Australia, April 29, 2015. On the world's driest inhabited continent, drought is a part of life, with the struggle to survive in a land short on water a constant thread in the country's history. California is looking to Australia for advice on surviving its own drought. 
California lawmakers are joining environmental, labor and business leaders on a trip to see how Australia managed its longest and most severe drought on record. 
The 9-day visit that began Monday comes as California finishes its fourth year of drought . Australia endured a 12-year drought from 1997 to 2009. 
Democratic Senate President Pro Tem Kevin de Le√≥n of Los Angeles says California can learn how to adapt to what could be more frequent extreme weather due to climate change. 
Assembly Minority Leader Kristin Olsen, a Republican from Modesto, is among the 11 lawmakers from both political parties on the trip. 
Also attending is California Water Commission member Daniel Curtin.
